title: Waterperry Wood
text:
Waterperry Wood is a biological <a href="Site%20of%20Special%20Scientific%20Interest">Site of Special Scientific Interest</a> (SSSI) east of <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a> in <a href="Oxfordshire">Oxfordshire</a>. It is a <a href="Nature%20Conservation%20Review">Nature Conservation Review</a> site, Grade I, and is owned and managed by the <a href="Forestry%20Commission">Forestry Commission</a>.
This wood has been designated an SSSI because it contains a diverse and important insect fauna, with many nationally uncommon and rare species. There are nineteen species of nationally uncommon hoverflies, including five which are listed in the <a href="British%20Red%20Data%20Book">British Red Data Book of Insects</a>, many nationally uncommon beetles, thirty butterfly species and several rare moths.
